programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Period horror adventure starring Brendan Fraser and Jet Li. Intrepid explorers Rick and Evelyn O'Connell come out of retirement to join their archaeologist son Alex in a race to prevent the resurrected Dragon Emperor and his terracotta army from taking over the world Rob Cohen - Director Brendan Fraser - Rick O'Connell Jet Li - Emperor Han Maria Bello - Evelyn O'Connell John Hannah - Jonathan Carnahan Michelle Yeoh - Zi Yuan Luke Ford - Alex O'Connell Anthony Wong (1) - General Yang Isabella Leong - Lin.

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.sub-title: Action, Fantasy, Drama, Sci Fi ║ 2002 ║ PG
programme.desc: Action adventure fantasy starring The Rock. In ancient times, powerful warrior Memnon presides over the desert with the aid of sorceress Cassandra. In an attempt to bring down this mighty duo, the assassin Mathayus is hired to kill Cassandra and thereafter become king of the last free tribes.n Chuck Russell - Director Dwayne Johnson - Mathayus, the Scorpion King Michael Clarke Duncan - Balthazar Steven Brand - Memnon Kelly Hu - Cassandra Bernard Hill - Philos Grant Heslov - Arpid Peter Facinelli - Prince Takmet Ralf Moeller - Thorak Sherri Howard - Queen Isis Roger Rees - King Pheron.

programme.title: Transformers: Rise Of The Beasts
programme.sub-title: Action, Fantasy, War, Drama, Sci Fi ║ 2023 ║ 12A
programme.desc: In 1994 New York City, ex-serviceman Noah Diaz accepts a job from neighbourhood chancer Reek to steal a sports car. The high-end vehicle turns out to be robot-in-disguise Mirage, who propels Noah into the midst of a hunt for a precious Transwarp key. The device will allow Autobot leader Optimus Prime and his mechanised compatriots to return home to Cybertron. Fantasy prequel, starring Anthony Ramos and Dominique Fishback Steven Caple Jr - Director Anthony Ramos - Noah Dominique Fishback - Elena Lauren Velez - Breanna Diaz Peter Cullen - Optimus Prime Ron Perlman - Optimus Primal Peter Dinklage - Scourge Michelle Yeoh - Airazor Pete Davidson - Mirage Colman Domingo - Unicron Michael Kelly (2) - Agent Burke.

programme.title: Shazam! Fury of the Gods
programme.sub-title: Action, Comedy, Drama, Fantasy, Sci Fi, Crime/detective ║ 2023 ║ 12A
programme.desc: The Daughters of Atlas, aka Hespera, Kalypso and Anthea, arrive on Earth in search of stolen magic. The vengeful ancient gods threaten humanity, and the only brave souls standing in their destructive path are Shazam and his brightly costumed compatriots. programme.title: The Mummy
programme.sub-title: Action, Fantasy, Drama, Horror, Thriller, Sci Fi ║ 1999 ║ 12
programme.desc: Period horror adventure starring Brendan Fraser and Rachel Weisz. A party of archaeologists, led by American adventurer Rick O'Connell, discover a tomb containing the 3,000-year-old remains of a murderous Egyptian priest, Imhotep. When the mummy is accidentally disturbed, he unleashes his terrifying powers on those who have desecrated his resting place Stephen Sommers - Director Brendan Fraser - Rick O'Connell Rachel Weisz - Evelyn John Hannah - Jonathan Arnold Vosloo - Imhotep Kevin J O'Connor - Beni Jonathan Hyde - Egyptologist Oded Fehr - Ardeth Bay Omid Djalili - Warden.

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.sub-title: Action, Fantasy, Drama, Thriller, Horror ║ 2001 ║ PG
programme.desc: Period horror adventure sequel starring Brendan Fraser and Rachel Weisz. When the young son of Rick O'Connell and his Egyptologist wife find an ancient bracelet that holds power over the armies of the fearsome Scorpion King, it attracts the attention of Meela, reincarnated lover of the resurrected high priest Imhotep, who needs the artefact to help him defeat the Scorpion King and become the ultimate ruler Stephen Sommers - Director Brendan Fraser - Rick O'Connell Rachel Weisz - Evelyn / Nefertiri John Hannah - Jonathan Arnold Vosloo - Imhotep Oded Fehr - Ardeth Bay Patricia Velasquez - Meela / Anck-Su-Namun Dwayne Johnson - The Scorpion King Freddie Boath - Alex Alun Armstrong - Mr Hafez Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje - Lock-Nah Shaun Parkes - Izzy Buttons Aharon Ipale - Pharaoh Donna Air - Showgirl.

programme.title: The Book of Clarence
programme.desc: Biblical comedy starring LaKeith Stanfield. In AD 33 Jerusalem, debt-ridden criminal Clarence, the ne'er-do-well atheist brother of apostle Thomas, decides to make some much-needed cash by posing as a new messiah. programme.title: Asteroid City
programme.desc: Wes Anderson's sci-fi comedy drama starring Jason Schwartzman, Scarlett Johansson and Tom Hanks. programme.title: Blithe Spirit
programme.desc: Supernatural comedy starring Dan Stevens, Leslie Mann, Isla Fisher and Judi Dench. programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Period comedy drama starring Paul Giamatti, Da'Vine Joy Randolph and Dominic Sessa. Paul Hunham, the crotchety classics teacher at a boys' boarding school, is tasked with supervising the students who have been forced to stay on campus during the Christmas break. programme.title: No Hard Feelings
programme.desc: Faced with the possibility of losing her mother's house, a woman called Maddie answers an advert from a married couple, who are offering a Buick Regal car to anyone willing to 'date' their introverted 19-year-old son Percy before he attends college. Maddie promises to bring the teenager out of his shell. programme.title: Allelujah
programme.desc: A community hospital in Yorkshire affectionately known as the Beth is threatened with closure. The chairman of the hospital trust invites a film crew to spend time on the Shirley Bassey and Dusty Springfield geriatric wards, interviewing Sister Gilpin, Dr Valentine and the residents. Comedy drama, starring Jennifer Saunders, Judi Dench and Derek Jacobi Richard Eyre - Director.

programme.title: The Hurricane Heist

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine and Glenda Jackson in her final film Oliver Parker - Director Michael Caine - Bernie Jordan Glenda Jackson - Rene Jordan John Standing - Arthur Howard-Johnson Danielle Vitalis - Adele Victor Oshin - Scott Selwood Will Fletcher - Young Bernie.

programme.title: Ferrari
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Adam Driver and Penélope Cruz. Enzo Ferrari and his wife Laura have equal shares in their car-manufacturing company, but their marriage is in tatters following the death of their son, while the business is in financial peril. With the 1957 Mille Miglia endurance race looming, Enzo seeks victory for Ferrari, whatever the cost Michael Mann - Director Adam Driver - Enzo Ferrari Penélope Cruz - Laura Ferrari Shailene Woodley - Lina Lardi Sarah Gadon - Linda Christian Gabriel Leone - Alfonso de Portago Jack O'Connell - Peter Collins Patrick Dempsey - Piero Taruffi.

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.sub-title: Romance, Drama, Music, Musical, Arts And Culture ║ 2018 ║ 15
programme.desc: Musical romantic drama starring Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper. Rock star Jackson Maine meets aspiring songwriter Ally, a waitress who moonlights as a bar singer. programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: Drama starring rap artist Eminem and Kim Basinger. Jimmy "Rabbit" Smith is stuck in a dead-end factory job in a tough area of Detroit where he lives with his highly strung mother and little sister. Jimmy longs to break out of this bleak existence by making it as a rapper, but his road to stardom is going to be a rocky one Curtis Hanson - Director Marshall Mathers - Jimmy \Rabbit\ Smith Kim Basinger - Stephanie Brittany Murphy - Alex Mekhi Phifer - Future Evan Jones - Cheddar Bob Omar Benson Miller - Sol George Eugene Byrd - Wink De'Angelo Wilson - DJ Iz.

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Tom Cruise, Cuba Gooding Jr and Renée Zellweger. As a top agent at Sports Management International, Jerry Maguire knows his way around and is his own man... until one day he gets an attack of decency and finds himself out of a job. Now he must start from scratch. His only allies are a single mother, her cheeky young son and a second-rate player for the Arizona Cardinals Cameron Crowe - Director Tom Cruise - Jerry Maguire Cuba Gooding Jr - Rod Tidwell Renée Zellweger - Dorothy Boyd Kelly Preston - Avery Bishop Jerry O'Connell - Frank Cushman Jay Mohr - Bob Sugar Bonnie Hunt - Laurel Boyd Regina King - Marcee Tidwell Jonathan Lipnicki - Ray Boyd Todd Louiso - Chad the nanny Eric Stoltz - Ethan Valhere.

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. As the Second World War rages, American fashion model-turned-photographer Elizabeth "Lee" Miller defies the expectations of the era and travels to mainland Europe as a war correspondent for Vogue. Reporting from the frontline, Miller captures indelible images of the conflict, including the horrors found in the Nazi concentration camps at Buchenwald and Dachau Ellen Kuras - Director Kate Winslet - Lee Miller Andy Samberg - Davy Scherman Alexander Skarsgård - Roland Penrose Marion Cotillard - Solange D'Ayen Andrea Riseborough - Audrey Withers Noémie Merlant - Nusch Eluard Josh O'Connor - Young Man / Antony Penrose James Murray - Colonel Spencer Arinzé Kene - Major Jonesy Vincent Colombe - Paul Eluard.

programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: Oscar-winning historical drama starring Colin Firth, Helena Bonham Carter and Geoffrey Rush. As part of his royal duties, Prince Albert is required to speak at public events, a task made all the more difficult owing to his severe stammer. The death of his father and subsequent abdication of his older brother means that "Bertie" is to be crowned king. Unconventional speech therapist Lionel Logue is enlisted to help the future George VI find his voice - and despite Logue's disregard for all things stately, the two men form an unlikely bond Tom Hooper - Director Colin Firth - \Albert\, King George Vl Helena Bonham Carter - Queen Elizabeth Geoffrey Rush - Lionel Logue Guy Pearce - \David\, Edward Vlll Michael Gambon - King George V Timothy Spall - Winston Churchill Jennifer Ehle - Myrtle Logue Derek Jacobi - Archbishop Cosmo Lang Claire Bloom - Queen Mary Anthony Andrews - Stanley Baldwin Tim Downie - Duke of Gloucester Eve Best - Wallis Simpson Freya Wilson - Princess Elizabeth Ramona Marquez - Princess Margaret.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Anthony Hopkins and Johnny Flynn. In 1938, young British stockbroker Nicholas Winton visits Prague and becomes involved in an audacious plan to evacuate hundreds of Jewish children before the Nazis close the borders. Decades later, Winton's records of the mission reawaken painful memories of the youngsters he couldn't save - and set him on an unexpected path to laying his ghosts to rest James Hawes - Director Anthony Hopkins - Nicholas Winton Helena Bonham Carter - Babette Winton Johnny Flynn - Nicholas, as a young man Lena Olin - Grete Winton Romola Garai - Doreen Warriner Jonathan Pryce - Martin Blake Ziggy Heath - Martin Blake, as a young man Adrian Rawlins - Geoff Samantha Spiro - Esther Rantzen Marthe Keller - Betty Maxwell Alex Sharp - Trevor.

programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. programme.desc: Oscar-winning historical drama starring Colin Firth, Helena Bonham Carter and Geoffrey Rush. As part of his royal duties, Prince Albert is required to speak at public events, a task made all the more difficult owing to his severe stammer. programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Jan 2025
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: The Independent
programme.desc: During the final weeks of the most consequential presidential election campaign in US history, America is poised to elect either its first female president or finally break the country's two-party gridlock with its first viable independent candidate. An idealistic young journalist gets an opportunity to work with her idol, veteran Washington political columnist Nick Booker. Eli is pursuing a story about budget cuts and by following the money, she and Booker uncover a financial conspiracy that places the fate of the election, the country, and democracy in their hands. programme.desc: An Oscar-nominated Sigourney Weaver stars as Dian Fossey, the US scientist who dedicated her life to studying and protecting the mountain gorillas of Rwanda. Drama. (1988)(125 mins).

programme.desc: Moving fantasy starring Kevin Costner as a Iowa farmer who, in answer to a mystical voice, turns his cornfield into a baseball pitch, with miraculous results. (1989)(101 mins).

programme.title: Nineteen Nineteen
programme.desc: When a former patient of Sigmund Freud sees a TV interview with another of Freud's patients, she decides she has to meet him. Drama with Paul Scofield and Colin Firth. (1985)(99 mins).

programme.title: When Tomorrow Comes
programme.desc: A concert pianist unhappily married to a mentally ill woman falls in love with a waitress. Classic drama with Charles Boyer and Irene Dunne. (1939)(90 mins).

programme.desc: Tom Cruise stars as a struggling sports agent who falls for single mum Renee Zellweger. Top romantic comedy with Cuba Gooding Jr. Language. (1996)(132 mins).

programme.desc: Robert Zemeckis' whimsical, sextuple Oscar-winning fable stars Tom Hanks as an extraordinary man who leads a charmed existence over four turbulent decades of US history. (1994).

programme.desc: A man is thrown into the brutality of prison life when he gets two life sentences for a crime he claims he didn't commit. Drama starring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. (1995)(142 mins).

programme.desc: An Oscar-winning Tom Hanks stars as a gay lawyer fighting against wrongful dismissal with the help of attorney Denzel Washington. Mature themes. (1993)(120 mins).

programme.title: WTA Final: Linz 2024
programme.desc: In the final of WTA Linz, top seed Jelena Ostapenko faces the second seed Ekaterina Alexandrova. Ostapenko advanced with ease, while Alexandrova endured a three-hour semi-final. (04.02).

programme.title: US Open: Draper v Diaz
programme.desc: Jack Draper's US Open adventure continues with a second-round clash against Argentine Facundo Diaz Acosta. Draper's campaign began with victory in round one over Zhizhen Zhang.

programme.title: Graf v Seles 1995
programme.desc: Two greats of professional tennis contested the 1995 women's singles final at the US Open, as Monica Seles - returning from a terrifying on-court ordeal in 1993 - faced Steffi Graf.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: Defeating career-rival Novak Djokovic for the second tournament in a row, revisit the moment Andy Murray won his first ATP Masters 1000 event at Cincinnati in 2008.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: Within striking distance of a first Grand Slam final, it would take a four-set battle for Andy Murray to achieve his dream as the young Scot overcame Rafael Nadal at the 2008 US Open.

programme.title: Agassi v Martin 1999
programme.desc: Andre Agassi's 1999 career renaissance concluded with an unforgettable victory at the US Open, earning a fifth Grand Slam title at the expense of his fellow countryman Todd Martin.

programme.title: ATP Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: Number two seed Sebastian Korda of America stands between Felix Auger-Aliassime and a sixth tour-level title for the Canadian, as the two clash in the Adelaide International final. (11.01).

programme.title: WTA Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: In an all-American final at the Adelaide International, Jessica Pegula and Madison Keys contest the third instalment of their rivalry, with the head-to-head record at one apiece. (11.01).

programme.title: ATP Final: Auckland
programme.desc: Gael Monfils becomes the second-oldest player to reach an ATP Tour final since 1990, as the 38-year-old Frenchman meets Belgian qualifier Zizou Bergs in Auckland at the ASB Classic. (11.01).

programme.title: ATP Final: Dallas 2024
programme.desc: A champion is crowned at the Dallas Open as Tommy Paul faces countryman Marcos Giron. Paul is aiming to add a second ATP title to his résumé after triumph in Stockholm back in 2021. (11.02).

programme.title: WTA Final: Hua Hin 2024
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned at the 2024 Thailand Open, as the number two seed Lin Zhu of China faces 19-year-old Diana Shnaider in the final of this WTA 250 event. (04.02).

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: Aiming to emulate Andre Agassi in becoming the first player to defend the Toronto crown since 1995, Andy Murray would have to find a way past Roger Federer in a final for the first time.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: An extended look at Andy Murray's victory at the 2012 US Open. The Scot beat Novak Djokovic to become the first British man since Fred Perry in 1936 to win a Grand Slam singles title.

programme.title: ATP Final: Auckland
programme.desc: Gael Monfils becomes the second-oldest player to reach an ATP Tour final since 1990, as the 38-year-old Frenchman meets Belgian qualifier Zizou Bergs in Auckland at the ASB Classic. (11.01).

programme.title: WTA Final: Brisbane
programme.desc: World number one Aryna Sabalenka looks to claim a second Brisbane International title, after success in 2023, against qualifier Polina Kudermetova. (05.01).

programme.title: ATP Final: Montpellier 2024
programme.desc: The Open Sud de France - Montpellier final pits the second seed and former champion Alexander Bublik up against Croatia's Borna Coric. Bublik is chasing a fourth tour-level trophy. (04.02).

programme.title: US Open:Draper v Van De Zandschulp
programme.desc: Jack Draper appears on Grandstand as Botic van de Zandschulp - the man who shocked Carlos Alcaraz - stands between the 22-year-old Briton and a place in the US Open last 16.

programme.title: All The Goals: Cole
programme.desc: Between 1995 - 2001 Andy Cole was one of the most prolific strikers in the country, his goals helped United to glory both at home and in Europe.

programme.title: All The Goals: Ronaldo
programme.desc: Cristiano Ronaldo left an indelible mark during his first spell at Old Trafford, scoring 118 goals as he became one of the world's pre-eminent footballing talents.

programme.title: All The Goals: Van Nistelrooy
programme.desc: One of the Reds' greatest finishers, Ruud bagged 150 goals in 200 starts between 2001-2006. The stats speak for themselves, but his predatory instinct in front of goal is well worth reliving...

programme.title: All The Goals: Beckham
programme.desc: A wonderfully gifted player, David Beckham could strike a ball like no other. With pin-point precision, his free-kicks were a speciality.

programme.title: All The Goals: Cantona
programme.desc: One of the most flamboyant players ever to play the game, King Eric cemented his name in United's history between 1992-97. The Frenchman helped the Reds to four league titles and two FA Cup wins.

programme.title: All The Goals: Scholes
programme.desc: He scores goals...and lots of them in a fantastic career at United. From a fox in the box to some of the best strikes you'll ever see, this man has scored them all. A true legend.

programme.title: All The Goals: Yorke
programme.desc: A passion for goals with a smile to match. From 1998-2002 Dwight impressed with a record of more than a goal every other start.

programme.title: All The Goals: Solskjaer
programme.desc: The Norwegian forward will forever be etched in United's history with the famous winning goal in 1999. His knack of being in the right place at the right time made him a huge fans' favourite.

programme.title: FAC: v Oldham 93/94 SF Replay

programme.desc: United Archives 16/2/08. Sir Alex's 100th FA Cup game in charge of United saw them take on Arsenal, one of the oldest and fiercest foes.

programme.title: Tapia v Ayala 1999
programme.desc: The brilliant first bout between WBA bantamweight world champion Johnny Tapia and challenger Paulie Ayala, which was named The Ring magazine's 1999 Fight of the Year.

programme.title: BBl: Qualifier Hlts
programme.desc: A place in the final of the Big Bash League is up for grabs in the Qualifier. The loser of this contest will get a second shot in the Challenger. (21.01).

programme.title: LIVE: ICC W-U19 T20 WC: NZ v SAM
programme.desc: New Zealand and Samao meet at the 2025 ICC Women's Under-19 T20 World Cup in Malaysia. (22.01).

programme.title: S/Lge 24': Leeds v Leigh Hlts
programme.desc: Looking to bounce back from unexpected defeat to the Black and Whites, Leeds host Leigh Leopards in the Betfred Super League. Leigh recently produced a rousing display in Perpignan. (21.06).

programme.title: S/Lge 24': Hull KR v Catalans Hlts
programme.desc: Hull KR host Catalans Dragons in the Betfred Super League. Last time out, the Dragons came away from Perpignan with two points having overcome Huddersfield on home soil. (06.07).

programme.title: S/Lge 24': W'gton v H'Field Hlts
programme.desc: Warrington Wolves host Huddersfield Giants in the Betfred Super League. Matt Dufty was the match winner for Warrington previously as his side emerged 24-18 winners at Hull KR. (05.07).

programme.title: S/Lge 24': Hull KR v Catalans Hlts
programme.desc: Hull KR host Catalans Dragons in the Betfred Super League. Last time out, the Dragons came away from Perpignan with two points having overcome Huddersfield on home soil. (06.07).

programme.title: S/Lge 24': Warrington v Leeds Hlts
programme.desc: After their eight-try victory over Huddersfield last time out, Warrington Wolves host a Leeds Rhinos side hunting for their third consecutive Betfred Super League victory. (11.07).

programme.title: S/Lge 24': Wigan v St Helens Hlts
programme.desc: The Brick Community Stadium's derby day doubleheader concludes with a blockbuster clash between the table-topping champions, Wigan Warriors, and a third-placed Saints outfit. (12.07).

programme.title: Fight Nght Int: Kholmatov v Ford
programme.desc: Uzbek phenom Otabek Kholmatov faces off against American standout Raymond Ford for the vacant WBA featherweight world title in Verona, New York. (03.03).

programme.title: Fight Night Int
programme.desc: The undisputed world super-bantamweight title is on the line in Tokyo, as the formidable Japanese star Naoya Inoue defends his crown against Mexico's Luis Nery. (06.05).
